Download

GitHub

Source and some binaries are on github :

https://github.com/gbarrand/TouchSky.git

WARNING, WARNING, WARNING : in general the softinex apps exploit intensively GL-ES, you must put in high priority to run on a local machine. Running remotely by displaying on a local X11 server works, but you are going to loose a lot of reactivity, and we remember that reactivity is a corner stone of a good interactive experience.

Some pfits

On github, in the 1.0.0 release there are the M51_large.pfits.zip and CFHTLS_1.pfits.zip files containing "pyramid of fits" that you can visualise with the "Some pfits..." menu item. They must be unzipped under : 

    ~/Documents/TouchSky under Linux and macOS
 and :
    C:\Users\<user>\Documents\TouchSky under Windows-10.

See the TouchSky demos (French or English) on YouTube (under "Barrand TouchSky") to see how to navigate in these pyramids.

These are deposited also under an OpenStack virtual machine server at LAL. If the server is running (!) you may attempt to work on these pyramids remotely by selecting first the server with "Set host (local) => local => LAL Cloud 40 => Ok" and then choosing one of the pfits in the list.

Docker

TouchSky exists under gbarrand/touchsky (in lowercase) on:

https://hub.docker.com

As it is a X11 app, you have to setup the DISPLAY. On a Mac with XQuartz: 

     macOS> docker login  # to login on hub.docker.com
     macOS> docker pull gbarrand/touchsky:<version>  # WARNING : touchsky in lowercase.
     macOS> ifconfig  # to get your IP address.
        sh> DISPLAY=<IP>:0;export DISPLAY
     ( csh> setenv DISPLAY <IP>:0 )
     macOS> xhost + <IP>
     macOS> docker run -e DISPLAY=${DISPLAY} -v /tmp/.X11-unix:/tmp/.X11-unix:rw gbarrand/touchsky:<version>

If producing a out.jpg or out.png with the export menu item, you can get it on your host with: 

     macOS> docker ps  # to get the container id.
     macOS> docker cp <container id>:/root/Documents/TouchSky/out.jpg .   # WARNING : TouchSky and not touchsky.

On a Windows-10 with the X11/Xming server, from XLaunch, start Xming with "on" in the "No Access Control" box, or from the DOS prompt : 

    DOS> Xming :0 -multiwindow -clipboard -ac
 (you may have to kill Xming from "Task manager"), and :
    DOS> docker login
    DOS> docker pull gbarrand/touchsky:<version>
    DOS> docker run -e DISPLAY=10.0.75.1:0 gbarrand/touchsky:<version>
